page.title: 03WEDNESDAY CATTLE MARKET LEEK
page.content: The Cattle Market was originally where Smithfield shopping centre and the Monument are today moving to Junction road out of the town centre in 1955.It is owned by the Leek auctions. The auctioneer stands in the middle of the pen to receive the bids.There are 3 pens,one is for dairy cows,the second is for sheep and the odd pig and the last pen is for cows for slaughter.Also in the last pen are cows for rearing and then to be taken back when they can't produce milk and slaughtered. Farmers come to this sale from as far away as Sheffield and Derby.There are complaints sometimes about the pens and facilities and some farmers feel that Leek Cattle Market is too small.Many hill farmers however regard Leek Cattle Market with great affection.
